title: System Design Level 9 â€” Observability, Monitoring & Deployment
concept: Logging, metrics, tracing, health checks, rollouts and resiliency patterns.

questions.question: Observability in systems generally consists of:
questions.explanation: Logs, metrics, and distributed traces are core observability pillars.

questions.question: A health check endpoint (e.g., /healthz) is used to:

options.B: Allow load balancers/orchestrators to detect if an instance is healthy

questions.explanation: Health checks drive instance readiness/liveness and routing decisions.

questions.question: Metrics like p95 or p99 latency refer to:

options.B: Latency experienced by the slowest request only

questions.explanation: Percentiles show tail latency, critical for user experience.

questions.question: Distributed tracing helps you:

options.B: Follow a request across multiple microservices with correlation IDs

questions.explanation: Tracing tracks a request flow across services, exposing bottlenecks.

questions.question: Blue-green deployment pattern means:

options.A: Deploy on one environment while the other stays idle, then switch traffic
options.B: Deploy directly to production with no testing

questions.explanation: Blue-green keeps a stable (blue) and new (green) environment to switch traffic safely.

questions.question: Canary release pattern is used to:

options.A: Roll out new versions to 100% of users immediately
options.B: Roll out to a small subset of traffic first to detect issues early

questions.explanation: Canarying mitigates risk by testing changes with a small population first.

questions.question: Circuit breaker pattern in microservices:

options.B: Stops calls to a failing service temporarily to prevent cascading failures

questions.explanation: Circuit breakers open when failure rates are high, short-circuiting requests.

questions.question: Retry logic should typically:

options.B: Use bounded retries with exponential backoff and jitter

questions.explanation: Backoff with jitter avoids synchronized retry storms and respects capacity.

questions.question: A runbook or playbook is:

options.B: A documented set of steps for handling common incidents or operations

questions.explanation: Runbooks guide engineers during incidents with known procedures.

questions.question: Error budgets in SRE are used to:

options.A: Measure acceptable level of unreliability given an SLO

questions.explanation: An error budget quantifies allowed failure, guiding pace of releases vs reliability.
